newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends flat against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends flat against dollar.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed unchanged at 43.7400/7500 to the dollar in a steady interbank session on Thursday ahead of the weekend, dealers said.
They said there was significant demand for the greenback from importers but some fresh inflows on Wednesday kept the market stable.

Interbank call money rates closed at nine to 16 percent, slightly up from previous eight to 15 percent. Dealers attributed the rise to an outflow of about 400 million taka against purchases of central bank bills. The bills were auctioned on Wednesday.
